title: Doctor of Education Program: Experience-Based Educational Design Competency Enhancement for Learning Communities and Civic Researcher Roles in Social Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, experience in building social relationships in secondary education settings, basic understanding of educational policies and systems, and civic engagement/community collaboration experience
context.additional_context: Learners share insights on doctoral program experiences based on their secondary education fieldwork and conduct situational learning activities using mobile devices. Applying a cohort model to emphasize peer learning and mutual feedback, cultivating collaborative problem-solving skills within educational communities. Particularly expanding practical knowledge through case analyses considering the political/economic contexts, cultural diversity, and local community characteristics of educational settings

learning_goals: Learners will explain at least three cohort-based collaboration strategies for integrating doctoral dissertation research and propose knowledge-sharing methods leveraging social networks through the role of a citizen-researcher within educational systems.

Learners will identify at least three time management challenges (research, lecture preparation, administrative tasks) in doctoral education programs. Using a priority matrix (e.g., Eisenhower Matrix), they will develop an actionable two-week plan (including a weekly schedule template). Additionally, they will propose flexible scheduling strategies considering social networks and cultural diversity in educational settings.

Learners will submit project deliverables interpreting data analysis results within educational contexts in mobile environments, deriving educational implications reflecting the local community’s cultural background and economic conditions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
